javadoc: A dialog that has text fields to get user input.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a provider for a generic input dialog with the specified title,
 a label and a editable comboBox pre-populated with selectable values. The user
 can check the value of #isCanceled() to know whether or not 
 the user canceled the operation. To get the user selected value use the
 #getValue() value(s) entered by the user.  If the user cancelled the operation, then
 null will be returned from getValue().

params.name: dialogTitle
params.comment: used as the name of the dialog's title bar

params.name: label
params.comment: value to use for the label of the text field

params.name: messageIcon
params.comment: the icon to display on the dialog--can be null

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a provider for a generic input dialog with the specified title,
 a label and a editable comboBox pre-populated with selectable values. The user
 can check the value of #isCanceled() to know whether or not 
 the user canceled the operation. To get the user selected value use the
 #getValue() value(s) entered by the user.  If the user cancelled the operation, then
 null will be returned from getValue().

params.name: dialogTitle
params.comment: used as the name of the dialog's title bar

params.name: label
params.comment: value to use for the label of the text field

params.name: messageIcon
params.comment: the icon to display on the dialog--can be null

methods.javadoc: Returns if this dialog is canceled.
methods.name: isCanceled
methods.comment: Returns if this dialog is canceled.

methods.javadoc: return the value of the first combo box
methods.name: getValue
methods.comment: return the value of the first combo box

name: InputWithChoicesDialog
comment: A dialog that has text fields to get user input.
